episodeTitle: A Mysterious Mermaid Appears? As Consciousness Fades Away...
episodeTitleJapanese: 幻の人魚現る？薄れゆく意識のなかで
episodeTitleRomanized: Maboroshi no Ningyo Arawaru? Usure Yuku Ishiki no Naka de
description: Kokoro reveals her true identity as a mermaid to save the drowning Straw Hat crew in the flooded tunnel. Meanwhile, Franky helps Robin overcome her trauma from the Ohara Buster Call, leading to her emotional breakthrough. As the crew escapes on Spandam's hijacked ship, Oimo and Kashii break out with the Franky Family and Galley-La, only to face three Marine warships.

openingSong.title: Crazy Rainbow
openingSong.titleJapanese: クレイジーレインボー

events.title: Luffy's Gear Third Side Effect Displayed
events.description: After using Gear Third, Luffy shrinks to a miniature chibi-sized version of himself, demonstrating the weakness of his new technique. In this shrunken state, he has little to no ability to stretch and loses incredible amounts of strength, with his punches having no effect on Lucci.
events.significance: Showcases the critical drawback of Gear Third that makes Luffy vulnerable after using the technique. The shrinking duration is roughly equivalent to the time spent in Gear Third mode, creating a strategic trade-off.

events.title: Kokoro Revealed as a Mermaid
events.description: As the Straw Hat crew drowns in the flooded underground tunnel, Kokoro reveals her true identity as an icefish mermaid. She transforms into her mermaid form and carries the unconscious crew members through the water to safety. The crew initially sees a beautiful mermaid saving them, but the reality of Kokoro's appearance shocks them into near-unconsciousness.
events.significance: This is the first confirmed mermaid the Straw Hats encounter in the series, marking a significant moment in the world-building. Kokoro explains that mermaids' tail fins split in two when they turn 30, allowing them to live on land. The reveal is both heroic and comedic, becoming a memorable moment in the arc.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky explains what shock could put someone in suspended animation after seeing Kokoro's mermaid form

events.title: Robin Remembers Saul's Words
events.description: In a critical emotional moment, Robin experiences flashbacks to Jaguar D. Saul and his final words to her during the destruction of Ohara. She recalls his unique laugh (Dereshishishi) and his encouragement to laugh whenever she was sad, even if it hurt. Saul's promise that she would find friends who would protect her echoes in her mind.
events.significance: This flashback is crucial to Robin's character development and emotional breakthrough. It connects her traumatic past at Ohara to her current situation at Enies Lobby, setting up her realization that she is no longer alone.

quotes.text: Dereshishishi! You'll find friends who will protect you someday!
quotes.speaker: Jaguar D. Saul
quotes.context: Saul's final promise to young Robin during the Ohara incident

events.title: Franky Rejects Spandam's Bribe and Punches Him
events.description: Spandam attempts to bribe Franky, offering to erase his criminal charges in exchange for handing over Robin. This is the same type of deal that was denied to Tom eight years ago. Instead of accepting, Franky violently refuses by punching Spandam in the face, declaring his loyalty to Robin and the Straw Hats.
events.significance: This moment represents poetic justice and character growth for Franky. The powerless apprentice who couldn't save Tom has become strong enough to punch the son of the man who destroyed his mentor. This act of defiance inspires Robin to overcome her trauma and marks Franky's commitment to the crew.

quotes.text: I don't need your deals! This is for what you and your father did to Tom!
quotes.speaker: Franky

events.title: Robin Overcomes Her Trauma from Ohara
events.description: Witnessing Franky's defiance and remembering Saul's words, Robin has a profound emotional breakthrough. She suddenly realizes that this Buster Call is different from Ohara. She is no longer alone and no longer needs to be afraid. The memory of her friends standing on the bridge, declaring war on the world for her sake, gives her the courage to move forward.
events.significance: This is one of the most pivotal character moments in Robin's entire arc. It marks the completion of her emotional journey from someone who wanted to die to someone who wants to live. This moment validates the entire Enies Lobby arc and the crew's declaration of war on the World Government.

quotes.text: This Buster Call... is different from Ohara. Because I'm no longer alone!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's realization that she has friends who will protect her

events.title: Spandam Mocks Luffy's Supposed Death
events.description: Spandam, unaware that Luffy is still fighting, mocks the pirate and brags about the power of the Buster Call. He believes Luffy has been killed in the attack and continues to taunt Robin and Franky about the overwhelming might of the World Government.
events.significance: Demonstrates Spandam's arrogance and ignorance of the situation. His premature celebration sets up his eventual comeuppance when the Straw Hats successfully escape.

quotes.text: That Straw Hat fool must be dead by now! No one can survive the Buster Call!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam's arrogant assumption about Luffy's fate

events.title: Robin and Franky Hijack Spandam's Escape Ship
events.description: Robin and Franky take control of Spandam's government escape ship on the Bridge of Hesitation. Shortly after, Kokoro arrives, jumping onto the ship with the unconscious Straw Hat crew members she rescued from the flooded tunnel. The crew is now reunited on the escape vessel.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' escape from Enies Lobby. The hijacking of a government ship symbolizes their defiance and provides the means for their getaway from the Buster Call.

events.title: Oimo and Kashii Break Out with Allies
events.description: The two giants, Oimo and Kashii, break out of Enies Lobby along with the Franky Family and the Galley-La shipwrights. They fight their way through the Marine forces, creating a path for their escape from the island.
events.significance: Shows the massive alliance that formed to rescue Robin. The giants' strength is crucial in helping the weaker allies escape the Marine stronghold.

events.title: Three Marine Warships Confront the Escapees
events.description: As Oimo, Kashii, the Franky Family, and Galley-La Company attempt to escape from Enies Lobby, they are confronted by three Marine warships. The massive vessels block their path, threatening to prevent their escape and potentially recapture or eliminate the entire rescue force.
events.significance: Escalates the danger level of the escape attempt. This confrontation sets up the next major obstacle the allies must overcome to successfully leave Enies Lobby alive. It demonstrates that even after defeating CP9, the World Government's forces are far from depleted.

events.title: The Buster Call Continues to Devastate Enies Lobby
events.description: Throughout the episode, the Buster Call's bombardment continues to rain down on Enies Lobby. The island is being systematically destroyed by the Marine warships, creating an apocalyptic backdrop to the escape attempts. Buildings crumble and fires rage across the judicial island.
events.significance: Maintains the tension and urgency of the escape. The ongoing Buster Call serves as a constant reminder of the stakes and creates a ticking clock for all characters still on the island. It also parallels the Ohara Buster Call from Robin's past.

quotes.text: This Buster Call... is different from Ohara. Because I'm no longer alone!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's emotional breakthrough and realization that she has friends

quotes.text: I don't need your deals! This is for what you and your father did to Tom!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky rejecting Spandam's bribe before punching him

quotes.text: Dereshishishi! You'll find friends who will protect you someday!
quotes.speaker: Jaguar D. Saul
quotes.context: Saul's promise to young Robin during the Ohara flashback

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Explaining what put the crew in suspended animation after seeing Kokoro's mermaid form

themes.description: Robin's journey from being haunted by the Ohara tragedy to realizing she is no longer alone represents the power of friendship to heal deep psychological wounds. The support of the Straw Hats gives her the strength to face another Buster Call without fear.
themes.symbolism: The Buster Call serves as a parallel between Robin's past and present, highlighting how friendship has transformed her from a scared child into someone with the courage to live.

themes.description: Franky's confrontation with Spandam represents his growth from a powerless apprentice who couldn't save Tom to a strong man capable of standing up to the World Government. His punch symbolizes justice for Tom's death.
themes.symbolism: Franky punching the son of the man who killed his mentor represents the cycle of justice and the strength gained through adversity.

themes.description: Kokoro's sacrifice to save the drowning crew, despite knowing her reveal will shock them, demonstrates the unconditional nature of the bonds formed in the series. Similarly, the alliance of giants, shipwrights, and dismantlers working together shows the strength of chosen family over blood relations.
themes.symbolism: The merging of different groups (Straw Hats, Franky Family, Galley-La, giants) symbolizes how diverse individuals can unite for a common cause.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin experiences her most significant character breakthrough in the series. She overcomes her lifelong trauma from the Ohara incident and fully accepts that she has found the friends Saul promised her. This marks her true acceptance into the Straw Hat crew.
keyActions: Witnesses Franky's defiance of Spandam
Remembers Saul's final words and promise
Has emotional breakthrough realizing she's no longer alone
Helps hijack Spandam's escape ship
Decides to fight for her life instead of surrendering to fear
quotes: This Buster Call... is different from Ohara. Because I'm no longer alone!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his loyalty to Robin and his own character growth by standing up to Spandam, the son of the man responsible for Tom's death. His actions directly inspire Robin's breakthrough and cement his role as a future Straw Hat.
keyActions: Rejects Spandam's bribe to hand over Robin
Punches Spandam in the face
Helps hijack the escape ship
Explains the crew's shock at seeing Kokoro's mermaid form
Supports Robin through her trauma
quotes: I don't need your deals! This is for what you and your father did to Tom!

characterSpotlights.development: Kokoro reveals her true nature as a mermaid to save the drowning Straw Hats, sacrificing her secret and dignity to ensure their survival. Her heroism showcases her deep care for the crew.
keyActions: Transforms into mermaid form
Carries unconscious crew through flooded tunnel
Brings crew to Spandam's escape ship
Explains mermaid biology (tail fins splitting at age 30)

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy experiences the severe drawback of Gear Third, becoming miniaturized and vulnerable. Despite this weakness, his presence in battle continues to influence events.
keyActions: Shrinks to chibi form after Gear Third expires
Continues fighting Lucci despite reduced size and strength
Lands ineffective punches on Lucci

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam's arrogance reaches its peak as he believes victory is assured. He attempts to bribe Franky and mocks the supposedly dead Luffy, showing his cowardice and overconfidence.
keyActions: Attempts to bribe Franky
Brags about the Buster Call's power
Gets punched in the face by Franky
Mocks Luffy's supposed death
quotes: That Straw Hat fool must be dead by now! No one can survive the Buster Call!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Kokoro's mermaid reveal with additional reaction shots from the Straw Hat crew members and more elaborate underwater swimming sequences compared to the manga's more condensed presentation.
Robin's emotional flashbacks to Saul are extended in the anime with additional dialogue and more detailed flashback imagery from the Ohara incident.
The anime adds more detail to Franky's confrontation with Spandam, including extended dialogue and additional reaction shots.

trivia.fact: Episode 306 aired on April 22, 2007, in Japan, during the climax of the Enies Lobby arc, which is widely considered one of the best arcs in One Piece history.
This episode adapts portions of Chapters 423 ('The Mermaid Legend') and 424 ('Escape Ship'), covering pages 2-19 of Chapter 423 and pages 4-6 of Chapter 424.

Kokoro's reveal as a mermaid became one of the most memorable comedic moments in One Piece, with the Straw Hats later pretending that Camie was the first mermaid they ever met to repress their memories of Kokoro.

The opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa was used from episodes 284-325, covering the majority of the Enies Lobby and Post-Enies Lobby arcs. The duo was even animated into the opening for Episode 303 to celebrate April Fool's Day in 2007.

The anime stopped using ending themes starting from episode 279, making this episode part of the era where only opening themes were featured. Instead, One Piece had extended opening sequences of almost 3 minutes instead of the usual 1:30 minute openings.

Kokoro explains in this episode that mermaids' tail fins split in two when they turn 30 years old, allowing them to walk on land. This is an important piece of world-building about mermaid biology in the One Piece universe.

Robin's emotional breakthrough in this episode directly parallels her 'I want to live!' declaration from Episode 278, completing her character arc from wanting to die to choosing to live with her friends.
Luffy's chibi form after Gear Third became a recurring visual gag until the time skip. After two years of training, Luffy mastered Gear Third and no longer shrinks when deactivating it.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 3 Techniques - One Piece Wiki
